alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Southeast Bighorn Basin; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 11:21AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN NATRONA... SOUTHWESTERN JOHNSON AND SOUTHEASTERN WASHAKIE COUNTIES THROUGH NOON MDT... At 1119 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles south of Big Trails to 11 miles southwest of Red Wall to 10 miles northeast of Powder River to 6 miles southwest of Goldeneye Reservoir. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. A brief funnel cloud is also possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Goldeneye Reservoir around 1125 AM MDT. Red Wall around 1130 AM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Hole In The Wall. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 201 and 206. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
